thread.title: Shotgun lost between Barrie and Essa recovered and returned to owner | CTV News
thread.title_full: Shotgun lost between Barrie and Essa recovered and returned to owner | CTV News

author: @CTVBarrieNews
title: Shotgun lost between Barrie and Essa recovered and returned to owner | CTV News
text: [Skip to main content](#main) Shotgun lost between Barrie and Essa returned to owner: OPP Provincial police say a firearm that went missing from a pickup truck earlier this month has been found and returned to its owner. - [Download the CTV News app to get local alerts on your device](http://www.ctvnews.ca/app) - [Get the latest local updates sent to your email inbox](http://www.ctvnews.ca/newsletters) Nottawasaga OPP says the shotgun slipped from the hunter's truck around the 6th Line of Essa and Barrie [on Dec. 8](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/opp-looking-for-lost-shotgun-between-barrie-and-alliston-1.6680817) as the owner travelled. Police described it as "a hard-shell shotgun case with a lock on it, containing a camouflage pump-action Mossberg 500 shotgun with a sling attached." "Fortunately, a vigilant citizen found the firearm and promptly turned it in to the local police station," OPP stated in a release on Friday. The service credited the "swift response and responsible actions" of the community for playing a "crucial role in the safe recovery of the lost firearm." [Shopping Trends](https://www.ctvnews.ca/shopping.html) The Shopping Trends team is independent of the journalists at CTV News. We may earn a commission when you use our links to shop. [Read about us.](https://www.ctvnews.ca/shopping/about-us.html) [Top Stories](https://barrie.ctvnews.ca/) CTVNews.ca Top Stories [Pocketbook concerns and even conflict abroad weigh on New Year's Eve spending plans](https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/pocketbook-concerns-and-even-conflict-abroad-weigh-on-new-year-s-eve-spending-plans-1.6704803) With Christmas and Boxing Day in the rear-view mirror, consumers have one event left to take stock of how much they're willing to spend: New Year's Eve. [Ottawa teens who died falling through ice attended the same high school](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/ottawa-teens-who-died-falling-through-ice-attended-the-same-high-school-1.6704822) CTV News confirmed Ahmed Haitham and Riley Cotter attended John McCrae Secondary School in Ottawa's south-end. [Tipping fatigue: Expert says industry should proceed carefully](https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/tipping-fatigue-expert-says-industry-should-proceed-carefully-1.6689523) As tipping prompts continue to rise, one marketing expert is warning the restaurant and service industry may 'need to be a bit careful' about how high it sets its default tipping prompts, or risk alienating customers. ['We don't deserve it': B.C. man with Stage 4 cancer says he was denied insurance coverage](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/we-don-t-deserve-it-b-c-man-with-stage-4-cancer-says-he-was-denied-insurance-coverage-1.6704542) A B.C. man says his insurance provider has decided to cancel his and his wife’s coverage for failing to disclose a visit to the emergency room to the insurance provider nearly three years before he was diagnosed with Stage 4 colon cancer. [Dolly Parton sings 'I will always love you' to dying fan whose wish was to meet her](https://www.ctvnews.ca/entertainment/dolly-parton-sings-i-will-always-love-you-to-dying-fan-whose-wish-was-to-meet-her-1.6704763) After LeGrand Gold was diagnosed with Stage IV colorectal cancer, the Utah man put together a list of things he hoped to do in the time he had left. Meeting Dolly Parton was number 7. OBITUARY [Former Quebec Nordique forward Reggie Savage dies of cancer at 53](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/former-quebec-nordique-forward-reggie-savage-dies-of-cancer-at-53-1.6704632) NHL forward Reggie Savage, who played for the Quebec Nordiques and Washington Capitals, has died of cancer at the age of 53. [Rates of long COVID significantly lower among children compared to adults: Canadian study](https://www.ctvnews.ca/health/rates-of-long-covid-significantly-lower-among-children-compared-to-adults-canadian-study-1.6704646) A new study led by Canadian researchers has found that the rates of long COVID among children are substantially lower compared to adults. [New Ontario laws and regulations come into effect on New Year's Day](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/new-ontario-laws-and-regulations-come-into-effect-on-new-year-s-day-1.6704229) Several new Ontario laws and regulatory changes are set to come into effect on New Year's Day, including daycare safe-arrival rules and penalties for inappropriately accessing patients' personal health information. [Elon Musk and these other 9 bosses had a terrible, horrible, no good, very bad 2023](https://www.ctvnews.ca/business/elon-musk-and-these-other-9-bosses-had-a-terrible-horrible-no-good-very-bad-2023-1.6704368) For some top executives, 2023 is a year they would rather forget. Some of their companies lost billions of dollars. Some have lost their jobs. And others badly damaged their reputations and face even more trouble ahead in 2024. [Atlantic](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/) - [Public asked to avoid overcrowded N.B. emergency rooms unless absolutely necessary](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/public-asked-to-avoid-overcrowded-n-b-emergency-rooms-unless-absolutely-necessary-1.6704611) New Brunswick's francophone health agency is asking residents to avoid two of its emergency rooms unless absolutely necessary because of capacity issues. - [Weather warnings continue Friday in the Maritimes](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/weather-warnings-continue-friday-in-the-maritimes-1.6704396) Several weather warnings are in effect in the Maritimes Friday morning as freezing rain, rain and snow moves through the region. - [New Brunswick was ‘very close’ to 2023 election: Premier Higgs](https://atlantic.ctvnews.ca/new-brunswick-was-very-close-to-2023-election-premier-higgs-1.6704811) Premier Blaine Higgs reflects on the issues facing New Brunswick in 2023. [Montreal](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/) - [Once Canada's most popular premier, Quebec's Legault trails in polls after bad year](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/once-canada-s-most-popular-premier-quebec-s-legault-trails-in-polls-after-bad-year-1.6704555) For more than four years, Quebec's governing Coalition Avenir Quebec enjoyed a political honeymoon that lasted through the COVID-19 pandemic and helped the party get re-elected in 2022 with 90 of the province's 125 ridings. But after a year marked by a series of self-inflicted wounds, the CAQ, which came to power for the first time in 2018, is sinking in the polls. - [The NYE fireworks show in Montreal's Old Port has been cancelled](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/the-nye-fireworks-show-in-montreal-s-old-port-has-been-cancelled-1.6704592) Montrealers hoping to start the new year with a bang may be disappointed come Dec. 31; the annual fireworks show in the Old Port has been cancelled for the second year in a row. - OBITUARY OBITUARY [Former Quebec Nordique forward Reggie Savage dies of cancer at 53](https://montreal.ctvnews.ca/former-quebec-nordique-forward-reggie-savage-dies-of-cancer-at-53-1.6704632) NHL forward Reggie Savage, who played for the Quebec Nordiques and Washington Capitals, has died of cancer at the age of 53. [Ottawa](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/) - [Ottawa teens who died falling through ice attended the same high school](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/ottawa-teens-who-died-falling-through-ice-attended-the-same-high-school-1.6704822) CTV News confirmed Ahmed Haitham and Riley Cotter attended John McCrae Secondary School in Ottawa's south-end. - [Two teens dead after group falls through ice on the Rideau River in Ottawa](https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/two-teens-dead-after-group-falls-through-ice-on-the-rideau-river-in-ottawa-1.6702946) Ottawa police say two teens have died after they fell through the ice on the Rideau River in Ottawa's south end on Wednesday. Two other teens were treated for mild hypothermia. - [New Ontario laws and regulations come into effect on New Year's Day](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/new-ontario-laws-and-regulations-come-into-effect-on-new-year-s-day-1.6704229) Several new Ontario laws and regulatory changes are set to come into effect on New Year's Day, including daycare safe-arrival rules and penalties for inappropriately accessing patients' personal health information. [Toronto](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/) - [Ontario drivers will pay more to use stretch of Highway 407 in 2024](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/ontario-drivers-will-pay-more-to-use-stretch-of-highway-407-in-2024-1.6704540) Drivers using a portion of Highway 407 will see an increase in their bills next year. - [Here's how you can get around in Toronto on New Year's Eve](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/here-s-how-you-can-get-around-in-toronto-on-new-year-s-eve-1.6704755) The Toronto Transit Commission and Metrolinx are working to ensure that everyone gets home safely this New Year’s Eve. - [$2.2M worth of stolen vehicles recovered from GTA auto theft operation](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/2-2m-worth-of-stolen-vehicles-recovered-from-gta-auto-theft-operation-1.6704533) York Regional Police (YRP) say they have recovered 25 stolen vehicles valued at more than $2 million and charged six people after busting a GTA car theft operation. [Kitchener](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/) - [Another hit and run involving pedestrian in Waterloo Region](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/another-hit-and-run-involving-pedestrian-in-waterloo-region-1.6704489) Waterloo regional police say a pedestrian has been taken to hospital after being hit by a vehicle at Ottawa Street and David Bergey Drive. - [Woman sexually assaulted on public transit in Waterloo: Police](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/woman-sexually-assaulted-on-public-transit-in-waterloo-police-1.6704537) A 35-year-old Kitchener man has been arrested and charged with sexual assault after an incident on a bus Thursday evening in Waterloo. - [No one hurt after fire at Kitchener restaurants](https://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/no-one-hurt-after-fire-at-kitchener-restaurants-1.6703580) No one was hurt after flames broke out at a building containing two restaurants in Kitchener. [London](https://london.ctvnews.ca/) - [Woman dies in fire in Lambton County](https://london.ctvnews.ca/woman-dies-in-fire-in-lambton-county-1.6704520) Lambton County OPP and the Lambton Crime Unit are investigating a fatal house fire that claimed the life of a 74-year-old woman. - [Nuclear waste decision looms for South Bruce in 2024](https://london.ctvnews.ca/nuclear-waste-decision-looms-for-south-bruce-in-2024-1.6701457) By this time next year, Canada should know where it’s most radioactive nuclear waste will be permanently stored. - [Impaired driving charges laid after vehicle crashes into ditch](https://london.ctvnews.ca/impaired-driving-charges-laid-after-vehicle-crashes-into-ditch-1.6704318) Middlesex County OPP have charged a 38-year-old London resident after a vehicle ended up in the ditch. [Northern Ontario](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/) - [New Ontario laws and regulations come into effect on New Year's Day](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/new-ontario-laws-and-regulations-come-into-effect-on-new-year-s-day-1.6704229) Several new Ontario laws and regulatory changes are set to come into effect on New Year's Day, including daycare safe-arrival rules and penalties for inappropriately accessing patients' personal health information. - [Sudbury Five scores the first win in a new basket ball league](https://northernontario.ctvnews.ca/sudbury-five-scores-the-first-win-in-a-new-basket-ball-league-1.6704628) Thousands of fans packed Sudbury Community Arena for the Sudbury Five’s season-opening win over the London Lightning. - [Here are the top 5 items passengers forgot at Toronto Pearson Airport in 2023](https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/here-are-the-top-5-items-passengers-forgot-at-toronto-pearson-airport-in-2023-1.6701047) More than 27,000 items were lost by passengers and found at Toronto Pearson Airport in 2023, with laptops topping the list, according to the travel hub. [Windsor](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/) - [Two suspects wanted for retail thefts on Walker Road](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/two-suspects-wanted-for-retail-thefts-on-walker-road-1.6704543) Windsor police are looking for two male suspects following a series of thefts from a retail store in the 1300 block of Walker Road. - [Oil spill investigated in Little River](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/oil-spill-investigated-in-little-river-1.6704343) The source of an oil spill in east Windsor is under investigation. - [Crime Stoppers 2023 stats: increase in tips and arrests](https://windsor.ctvnews.ca/crime-stoppers-2023-stats-increase-in-tips-and-arrests-1.6704257) Windsor and Essex County Crime Stoppers is looking back on another successful year, with an increase in tips and arrests. [Calgary](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/) - [Power knocked out to several Calgary homes during police incident](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/power-knocked-out-to-several-calgary-homes-during-police-incident-1.6704459) Calgary police say one person is in custody following a break-and-enter in the northeast where the suspect's vehicle crashed into an electrical box, knocking out power to a number of homes. - [Here's how you can celebrate New Year's Eve 2024 throughout the entire day](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/here-s-how-you-can-celebrate-new-year-s-eve-2024-throughout-the-entire-day-1.6704629) Midnight isn't the only time to celebrate the new year in Calgary, there are events aimed at ringing in 2024 throughout the day on Dec. 31. - [Hitmen fall short in Prince George, falling 3-2 to Cougars on opening of B.C. road trip](https://calgary.ctvnews.ca/hitmen-fall-short-in-prince-george-falling-3-2-to-cougars-on-opening-of-b-c-road-trip-1.6704824) The Calgary Hitmen came up short on the opening night of their B.C. road trip Thursday night, dropping a 3-2 game to the Prince George Cougars. [Saskatoon](https://saskatoon.ctvnews.ca/) - [Blizzards, smoke, drought and flooding: Here are Sask.'s top 5 weather stories of 2023](https://regina.ctvnews.ca/blizzards-smoke-drought-and-flooding-here-are-sask-s-top-5-weather-stories-of-2023-1.6704573) From thick wildfire smoke, to 60 centimetres of snow in a single storm, to a rare lack of tornados and record-breaking drought, here are Saskatchewan’s top five weather stories from 2023. - [Saskatoon developers hint at future of former Extra Foods property](https://saskatoon.ctvnews.ca/saskatoon-developers-hint-at-future-of-former-extra-foods-property-1.6703422) The site of a former grocery store on Broadway Avenue has sold. - [Dash cam footage shows van burst into flames in a Saskatoon parking lot](https://saskatoon.ctvnews.ca/dash-cam-footage-shows-van-burst-into-flames-in-a-saskatoon-parking-lot-1.6703622) Saskatoon firefighters say they don’t know what caused a van to burst into flames in a Cabela’s parking lot on Wednesday. [Edmonton](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/) - ['Heartbreaking': City and police close first of 8 'high-risk' encampments](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/heartbreaking-city-and-police-close-first-of-8-high-risk-encampments-1.6704695) Cleanup of the first of eight high-risk encampments began Friday morning. - [Mayor Sohi rides the Valley Line rails to recap the biggest Edmonton stories of 2023](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/mayor-sohi-rides-the-valley-line-rails-to-recap-the-biggest-edmonton-stories-of-2023-1.6704572) Much like in the streets, neighbourhoods and transit centres governed by its council, it's been a year of highs and lows at Edmonton city hall. - [2 homes destroyed in suspected arson Friday morning: EPS](https://edmonton.ctvnews.ca/2-homes-destroyed-in-suspected-arson-friday-morning-eps-1.6704815) Fires broke out in two homes under construction in southwest Edmonton early Friday morning. [Vancouver](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/) - ['We don't deserve it': B.C. man with Stage 4 cancer says he was denied insurance coverage](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/we-don-t-deserve-it-b-c-man-with-stage-4-cancer-says-he-was-denied-insurance-coverage-1.6704542) A B.C. man says his insurance provider has decided to cancel his and his wife’s coverage for failing to disclose a visit to the emergency room to the insurance provider nearly three years before he was diagnosed with Stage 4 colon cancer. - [B.C. woman defrauded of $80K in crypto scam, RCMP say](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/b-c-woman-defrauded-of-80k-in-crypto-scam-rcmp-say-1.6704756) Mounties are warning the public after a woman in B.C.'s Interior lost tens of thousands of dollars after falling victim to a crypto scam. - [Bad haircut, lengthy food delivery waits, lost nose ring: Here's the top 10 nuisance 911 calls made in B.C.](https://bc.ctvnews.ca/bad-haircut-lengthy-food-delivery-waits-lost-nose-ring-here-s-the-top-10-nuisance-911-calls-made-in-b-c-1.6704675) As we prepare to ring in the New Year, B.C.'s emergency dispatch centre for 911 calls is reminding the public to think twice about what is considered an emergency before dialing 911.
